direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve creating a string representation of internal data structures, with similar control flows and data handling.
Both methods provide access to the internal options data, though one returns a string representation and the other returns a collection of options.
Both methods involve accessing and returning information about the options, though one returns a string and the other returns a list of required options.
Both methods provide information about the options, though one returns a string and the other returns a collection of option groups.
Both methods are named 'toString' and serve the same purpose of providing a string representation of the object, though they are in different classes.
